title: Apolipoprotein E genotypes in relation with Hg (MeHg) concentrations in pregnant females

author: Ajda Trdin, Department of Environmental Sciences, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: Hello everybody, I hope you're not too tired until now.
Let me first explain Whyyou should listen closely to what I have to say so we were very.
Interested in Mercury, why Mercury?
Mercury is a global pollutant.
And basically, all of you, all of us are exposed to organic Mercury as material Mercury through fishing tech media.
Mercury has no biological role and it can be very toxic for our health.
Our study population were pregnant females.
Why?
Because I think we are all very interested in what I'll chill.
Children are exposed to, especially in their early development and why genetic background.
If we compare two individuals which are living the same.
Or compatible lifestyle there.
Mercury concentration can vary a lot and one of possible explanations for such differences in Mercury concentration can be genetical.
So there are several genes which are involved in methylmercury metabolism in our body.
We picked just one of them and study its Association with methylmercury.
So what we did was basically, we measured methylmercury in blood of participating pregnant females, and we determined there Geno type.

There are three possible alleles, epsilon, two epsilon free, an epsilon, four, and we were especially interested in presence of epsilon 4 because according to literature epsilon for carriers can have higher material.
Mercury concentration according to other two possible alleles, epsilon two and epsilon free.
Ah, so we.
According to this, we divided our population into two groups, epsilon for carriers and epsilon for non carriers.

Then we compute exam statistics of course, and in the first stage we concluded that epsilon for carriers indeed have higher slightly but significantly higher metal Mercury concentrations in comparison to other group.
But however we cannot say that just only one gene is responsible for Matthew Mercury concentration in our blood.
So we have to take into consideration also other parameters which were available and are known to have impacts on metal Mercury concentration in body so.
The most important important one were frequency or seafood intake.
Maternal age, number of children, body mass index and smoking.

So after that we saw that basically higher Matthew Mercury concentration in epsilon for carriers was just a coincidence because if some for carriers 8 fish more frequently and that is where higher methylmercury concentration came from.
So I can conclude that even if you have this epsilon four variant, you don't have to worry because it's not necessary that you will also have higher melting Mercury concentrations.
Thank you.
